title: Mobile Microlearning for Strengthening COVID-19 Medical Response Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Conducted in a limited technological environment centered on smartphones, assessing practical application skills through project-based evaluations.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the etiology, transmission routes, and prevention methods of COVID-19 based on scientific evidence.

In two-week practical scenarios (operating room/infectious disease ward), learners perform three-stage infection control protocols (hand hygiene, equipment disinfection, waste disposal) and PPE (gloves, masks, gowns) donning/doffing procedures with 90% accuracy and explain the scientific rationale for each step within three minutes.

Learners analyze three community infectious disease outbreak cases, write a five-page proposal applying public health strategies (quarantine, isolation, vaccination), and meet four or more of the five rubric criteria (clarity, feasibility, scientific basis, creativity, practicality).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
